Design

Mobile First

I approach web design with an aim to create responsive and aesthetically pleasing interfaces for all types of devices, platforms, and browsers.

Portfolio

Browse A Series Of Personal Projects


Vice Grip App

Demo Code

This was my first Rails application and a collaboration with 3 other students. Once you are logged in, you can begin adding vices. Attached to each vice is a daily cost and an end goal that you can be rewarded with once you have given up your vice. Vice Grip will track your daily progress, showing you how much money your saving and the time until you can reach your goal.

Whack-A-Mole Game

DemoCode

For my first development project I was tasked with creating a javascript two player game. I created a simple whack-a-mole game utilizing Illustrator for the graphics and Javascript/Jquery for the game functionality.

Mapper

DemoCode

This was my second project using Node.js and a collaborative effort with 2 students. Mapper makes planning your day easier. You choose a day, a start time, add errands and events along with their locations, and Mapper does the rest. Get accurate times on when you will get to and leave from places on your list. Find out how much time you will spend on your day plan.

experience

Download My Full Resume

  • FAT BEATS DISTRIBUTION

    E-Commerce Manager | August 2010 - March 2016

    • Internal design lead, responsible for pre-flighting all incoming projects; confirming & assisting that submission be ready for print with all predetermined/required specifications.
    • Managed more than 200 active projects at any given time.
    • Monitored company catalog inventory and forecasted/scheduled reorders.
    • Singlehandedly rebuilt e-commerce site from the ground up using the Shopify platform.
    • Redeveloped and streamlined Production & E-Commerce procedures.
    • New e-commerce site and procedures led to a 10 fold increase in revenue as compared with the year before restructuring and redesign.
    • Promoted to E-Commerce Manager after displaying a knowledge and ability to redevelop the outdated and underperforming legacy system.
    • Digital asset manager in charge of set up and marketing efforts for all digital content as well as sync opportunities.
    • Successfully secured placements for companies including Apple & Ubisoft.

  • WAX POETICS MAGAZINE

    Special Projects Database Manager | July 2009 - June 2010

    • Hired on from internship role to manage the digital and physical assets and database for Codigo Group through their partnership with Wax Poetics.
    • In charge of asset organization, database development and catalog research.
    • Assistant to the digital music web store formerly hosted on Waxpoetics.com and operated on the Audiosalad platform.


Album Design

Selected Design Work


Dibia$e - Baker's Dozen

Baker’s Dozen, an exclusive vinyl series that shines a light on the best minds of instrumental hiphop, ambient, and electronic music. Each installment gives one artist carte blanche to capture their signature sound. Every volume’s 500-unit, strictly limited vinyl pressing features one artist and twelve tracks, but only 250 units will contain the thirteenth track -- the eponymous “baker’s dozen bonus” -- on a flexi disc.

Blu & Exile - Give Me My Flowers Instrumentals

Featuring Fashawn, Homeboy Sandman, Johaz of Dag Savage, Black Spade of Hawthorne Headhunters, and ADAD, the new album on Fat Beats / Dirty Science is both an evolution from and complement to their first: a cohesive, kicked back collection of hip-hop buoyed by Blu’s gymnastic wordplay and Exile’s soulful, sample-driven beats. While Blu’s penchant for introspection and analysis remains intact, his perspective ebbs from the sun-soaked nostalgia of Below the Heavens to a more playful realm where raps about lost love and forgotten dreams find equal footing with those about Gondry films and delivery cheesecake. Together Blu & Exile have taken the raw materials of rap and crafted charmingly idiosyncratic, album-minded music that transcends coasts and continents alike.
